page.title: 02CLYST VALLEY:AGRICULTURE.
page.content: The agricultural land of this area is rich and fertile. The soil varies from sand to clay very sharply.As the valley is very flat and low lying,land near the river is liable to flood in the winter and remains wet even in summertime.These parts are left as permanent grassland of an indifferent quality and are used for grazing so long as the land remains firm enough to support the weight of cattle. The arable land is used mainly to grow fodder crops e.g.wheat,barley,maize,peas and beans. to feed the dairy herds.Some cash crops such as potatoes are grown but this is relatively unimportant. The area also has several nursery gardens and smallholdings.
